result.execSummary:
The defendant William Earl Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ORDERS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William Earl Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.   10 days,  consecutive.  Due & owing.

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 2/5/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may request an extension if making payments, and court will grant.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Attorney Scholle appears by phone.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Defense cousnel requests an adjournment.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 8/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for motion hearing.  State ready to proceed.  Defendant wishes to resolve the case.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 7/10/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
State's response to defendant's motion to suppress evidence, received and filed.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
State has filed a motion to adjourn motion hearing.  Court grants adjournment.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing on 6/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's motion to adjourn jury trial, received and filed.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant tested positive for THC.  Defendant warned to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Court is not modifying bail at this time.  Court WILL modify bail, if court receives another positive test.  Court increases defendant's supervision to ENHANCED with Justice Point.  Defendant to bring in verification of his treatment sessions at the next court date.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  aw

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 02-03-2014 received and filed. (19 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER MARY SCHOLLE, 819 N 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, wI  53203.

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a response to the state's motion.  Court will read attorney Scholle's response before the next court date.  State may respond if they choose before the next court date.  Court informs parties that she will sign an order if given an affidavit with the court and the court believes it is sufficient.  If court feels the affidavit is not sufficient, court will not sign until addressed on the record at the next court appearance.  Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 4/17/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw
Defendant's response to state's request to obtain a sample of defendant's bodily fluids for DNA profiling, received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties made statements concerning the buccal swabs.  Court will sign amended order.  State to do an amended affidavit.  Case adjourned for status conference on 3/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 4/7/2014. 
State has also received and filed a order for production of buccal samples, Notion of motion for production of buccal samples, and affidavit in support of motion for production of buccal samples.  Case adjourned for status to have defense oral arguments of the motion on 3/7/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Case also adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing on 4/17/2014 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 6/25/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Notice of motion and motion to suppress- illegal stop and search, received and filed.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Stephan E. Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel informs the court that she would like to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/4/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Kevin Shomin appeared for Antonella Aleman for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Gregory Colker.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF925 that are attached to the complaint.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 02-13-2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William Earl Johnson in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant William Earl Johnson in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
